content.$t:
首頁工作坊名: Prototyping the Future, 首頁工作坊標語: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.

- Alan Kay -, 首頁工作坊下標: idea factory, yunlin, taiwan, 2019, 關於主標題: Ouroboros, 關於主內容: "Ouroboros", 關於副內容: Which is an ancient
Egyptian iconography symbol depicting a serpent or dragon eating
its own tail. For its picturesque metaphor in shape and self-eating
activity, ouroboros was adopted as a notable symbol in Gnosticism,
Hermeticism, alchemy and being related to "∞" symbol in mathematics.
Ouroboros symbolize two ends in one line, where two opposing
forces are incompatible, but not in a confrontational position.
In addition, ouroboros can also be interpreted as infinity and
reborn again in the process of self-burning. Just as a cycle system
which contains people, events, time, space, and things, everything
included will constantly change and begin to develop by themselves.
With the eternal pattern of "destruction" and "construction" recursively.
In this anniversary international workshop, “Ouroboros”, we
will focus on 3 direction: biological, spatial, and social interaction,
try to explore the unique cycle pattern between destruction and the
construction in each fields., 時間表時間: date, 時間表期程: activities, 時間表資訊: info, 指導老師姓名: Yasushi Ikeda, 指導老師介紹: Professor of Architectural Informatics</br>
Keio University, Japan</br>
</br>
Prof.Yasushi Ikeda is an Architect, Professor of Architectural Informatics at Keio University. He graduated from the Department of Architecture University of Tokyo in 1985. After he completed the master in the Graduate School of Engineering, he joined Maki and Associates from 1987 to 1995. Then he left to establish the Yasushi Ikeda Design Studio (renamed IKDS in 2003). He is known internationally by many research activities in the field of architecture applying information technologies and currently working on design approach with computational methodology applying to sustainable building. His recent design projects include Daheguan Guanshange Hot spring resort Hotel Dalian China (2013), Keio co-evolution House (2014), MRT Airport line Taipei Main Station (2016), 指導老師路徑: img/headshot/1-1Ikeda.jpg, 主題名稱: Bonsai Bush 2.0, 主題主內容: Lecturer: Yasushi Ikeda, Kensuke Hotta, Alric Lee</br>
Hardware: Hololense and Robot arm</br>
Software: Rhino+Grasshopper and Fologram</br>
</br>
In this workshop, participants are expected to understand the idea of improvisational construction in digital twin environment. The outcome of the workshop is to make a real scale model ‘Timber Bonsai Bush’ by utilizing algorithms with computer power, trough Hololense. ‘Timber Bonsai Bush’ is a thought experimental structure, which made in simple rectangle wood timbers but assembled complex way, to study the possibility of improvisational design within the construction
(=fabrication) process., 主題路徑: img/reference/1-Ikeda.jpg, 聯絡地址: Idea Factory,, 聯絡電話: 886-5-534-2601  ext.6011
ext.6005, 聯絡email: workshop@idf.tw, 聯絡合作夥伴: Idea Factory, 聯絡合作夥伴網址: https://www.facebook.com/IDF-YunTech-%E5%89%B5%E6%84%8F%E5%B7%A5%E5%A0%B4-578189515652931/?ref=bookmarks, 聯絡合作夥伴圖片: img/connect/cooperate/idf.png, 背景幻燈片: img/slider-1.jpg, 主講老師姓名: Yasushi Ikeda, 主講老師介紹: Professor of Architectural Informatics</br>
Keio University, Japan</br>
</br>
Prof.Yasushi Ikeda is an Architect, Professor of Architectural Informatics at Keio University. He graduated from the Department of Architecture University of Tokyo in 1985. After he completed the master in the Graduate School of Engineering, he joined Maki and Associates from 1987 to 1995. Then he left to establish the Yasushi Ikeda Design Studio (renamed IKDS in 2003). He is known internationally by many research activities in the field of architecture applying information technologies and currently working on design approach with computational methodology applying to sustainable building. His recent design projects include Daheguan Guanshange Hot spring resort Hotel Dalian China (2013), Keio co-evolution House (2014), MRT Airport line Taipei Main Station (2016), 主講老師路徑: img/headshot/1-1Ikeda.jpg

gsx$首頁工作坊標語.$t:
The best way to predict the future is to invent it.

- Alan Kay -

gsx$關於副內容.$t:
Which is an ancient
Egyptian iconography symbol depicting a serpent or dragon eating
its own tail. For its picturesque metaphor in shape and self-eating
activity, ouroboros was adopted as a notable symbol in Gnosticism,
Hermeticism, alchemy and being related to "∞" symbol in mathematics.
Ouroboros symbolize two ends in one line, where two opposing
forces are incompatible, but not in a confrontational position.
In addition, ouroboros can also be interpreted as infinity and
reborn again in the process of self-burning. Just as a cycle system
which contains people, events, time, space, and things, everything
included will constantly change and begin to develop by themselves.
With the eternal pattern of "destruction" and "construction" recursively.
In this anniversary international workshop, “Ouroboros”, we
will focus on 3 direction: biological, spatial, and social interaction,
try to explore the unique cycle pattern between destruction and the
construction in each fields.

gsx$指導老師介紹.$t:
Professor of Architectural Informatics</br>
Keio University, Japan</br>
</br>
Prof.Yasushi Ikeda is an Architect, Professor of Architectural Informatics at Keio University. He graduated from the Department of Architecture University of Tokyo in 1985. After he completed the master in the Graduate School of Engineering, he joined Maki and Associates from 1987 to 1995. Then he left to establish the Yasushi Ikeda Design Studio (renamed IKDS in 2003). He is known internationally by many research activities in the field of architecture applying information technologies and currently working on design approach with computational methodology applying to sustainable building. His recent design projects include Daheguan Guanshange Hot spring resort Hotel Dalian China (2013), Keio co-evolution House (2014), MRT Airport line Taipei Main Station (2016)

gsx$主題主內容.$t:
Lecturer: Yasushi Ikeda, Kensuke Hotta, Alric Lee</br>
Hardware: Hololense and Robot arm</br>
Software: Rhino+Grasshopper and Fologram</br>
</br>
In this workshop, participants are expected to understand the idea of improvisational construction in digital twin environment. The outcome of the workshop is to make a real scale model ‘Timber Bonsai Bush’ by utilizing algorithms with computer power, trough Hololense. ‘Timber Bonsai Bush’ is a thought experimental structure, which made in simple rectangle wood timbers but assembled complex way, to study the possibility of improvisational design within the construction
(=fabrication) process.

gsx$主講老師介紹.$t:
Professor of Architectural Informatics</br>
Keio University, Japan</br>
</br>
Prof.Yasushi Ikeda is an Architect, Professor of Architectural Informatics at Keio University. He graduated from the Department of Architecture University of Tokyo in 1985. After he completed the master in the Graduate School of Engineering, he joined Maki and Associates from 1987 to 1995. Then he left to establish the Yasushi Ikeda Design Studio (renamed IKDS in 2003). He is known internationally by many research activities in the field of architecture applying information technologies and currently working on design approach with computational methodology applying to sustainable building. His recent design projects include Daheguan Guanshange Hot spring resort Hotel Dalian China (2013), Keio co-evolution House (2014), MRT Airport line Taipei Main Station (2016)

content.$t:
時間表時間: April 13, 2019 - June 14, 2019, 時間表期程: Call for Proposal, 時間表資訊:

Call for Proposal Link. Please fill the form below...

, 指導老師姓名: Kensuke Hotta, 指導老師介紹: Project Associate
Keio University, Japan

Dr. Kensuke Hotta is an architect, and a researcher currently based in Japan. He was born in Japan, completed his architectural training from AA School, UK. After working in the architectural practice, currently he serves Po-llc, computational consultancy, as a partner in Tokyo. In academia, he is lecturing in Keio university. He has been honoured with a scholarship from the Union Foundation, and has won several prizes at internationally held competitions., 指導老師路徑: img/headshot/1-2Hotta.jpg, 主題名稱: Visual Algorithms, 主題主內容: Lecturer:Andrew I-kang Li, Rudi Stouffs
Hardware: Laptop with Windows
Software: Rhinoceros3d v5 for Windows

Algorithms are everywhere in our daily lives. Algorithms for preparing food – recipes – are written in a natural language, such as Chinese or English. Participants in this workshop will learn two ways to use shape grammars. One is to infer algorithms by analyzing groups of designs and how to express those algorithms visually as shape grammars. The other is to create families of designs by creating visual algorithms that generate those designs., 主題路徑: img/reference/2-Andrew.jpg, 聯絡地址: 123 University Road, Section 3,, 聯絡合作夥伴: KIT, 聯絡合作夥伴網址: http://www.kit.ac.jp/en/, 聯絡合作夥伴圖片: img/connect/cooperate/kit.png, 背景幻燈片: img/slider-2.jpg, 主講老師姓名: Kensuke Hotta, 主講老師介紹: Project Associate
Keio University, Japan

Dr. Kensuke Hotta is an architect, and a researcher currently based in Japan. He was born in Japan, completed his architectural training from AA School, UK. After working in the architectural practice, currently he serves Po-llc, computational consultancy, as a partner in Tokyo. In academia, he is lecturing in Keio university. He has been honoured with a scholarship from the Union Foundation, and has won several prizes at internationally held competitions., 主講老師路徑: img/headshot/1-2Hotta.jpg

gsx$時間表資訊.$t: Call for Proposal Link. Please fill the form below...

gsx$指導老師介紹.$t:
Project Associate</br>
Keio University, Japan</br>
</br>
Dr. Kensuke Hotta is an architect, and a researcher currently based in Japan. He was born in Japan, completed his architectural training from AA School, UK. After working in the architectural practice, currently he serves Po-llc, computational consultancy, as a partner in Tokyo. In academia, he is lecturing in Keio university. He has been honoured with a scholarship from the Union Foundation, and has won several prizes at internationally held competitions.

gsx$主題主內容.$t:
Lecturer:Andrew I-kang Li, Rudi Stouffs</br>
Hardware: Laptop with Windows</br>
Software: Rhinoceros3d v5 for Windows</br>
</br>
Algorithms are everywhere in our daily lives. Algorithms for preparing food – recipes – are written in a natural language, such as Chinese or English. Participants in this workshop will learn two ways to use shape grammars. One is to infer algorithms by analyzing groups of designs and how to express those algorithms visually as shape grammars. The other is to create families of designs by creating visual algorithms that generate those designs.

gsx$主講老師介紹.$t:
Project Associate</br>
Keio University, Japan</br>
</br>
Dr. Kensuke Hotta is an architect, and a researcher currently based in Japan. He was born in Japan, completed his architectural training from AA School, UK. After working in the architectural practice, currently he serves Po-llc, computational consultancy, as a partner in Tokyo. In academia, he is lecturing in Keio university. He has been honoured with a scholarship from the Union Foundation, and has won several prizes at internationally held competitions.

Registration Link. Please fill the form below.

, 時間表圖片: img/info/resignation.jpg, 指導老師姓名: Alric Lee, 指導老師介紹: Academic Researcher
Keio University, Japan

Mr. Alric Lee is a scientist, and a computer engineer currently based in Tokyo. Originated from Hong Kong and educated in the U.S, U.K. and Japan, he engages in cross-disciplinary practice that spans between architecture, construction, and artificial intelligence for multinational clients. Now he is an academic researcher in Keio University in Japan. , 指導老師路徑: img/headshot/1-3Lee.jpg, 主題名稱: The Algorithm Design of Furniture, 主題主內容: Lecturer: Jian-You Li
Hardware: Robot arm
Software: Rhino, Grasshopper
In this workshop we will produce complete furniture and manufacturing data with recursive pattern and programming via simple geometry and parameters. And explanation of the content and construction process of recursive programming concept. And generate a large number of derivatives on its own, and evaluates the results by cost, space, or intensity. , 主題路徑: img/reference/3-Jianyou.jpg, 聯絡地址: Douliou, Yunlin 64002,, 聯絡合作夥伴: RSU, 聯絡合作夥伴網址: https://www.rsuip.org/, 聯絡合作夥伴圖片: img/connect/cooperate/rsu.png, 主講老師姓名: Alric Lee, 主講老師介紹: Academic Researcher
Keio University, Japan

Mr. Alric Lee is a scientist, and a computer engineer currently based in Tokyo. Originated from Hong Kong and educated in the U.S, U.K. and Japan, he engages in cross-disciplinary practice that spans between architecture, construction, and artificial intelligence for multinational clients. Now he is an academic researcher in Keio University in Japan. , 主講老師路徑: img/headshot/1-3Lee.jpg

Lecturer: Jian-You Li</br>
Hardware: Robot arm</br>

In this workshop we will produce complete furniture and manufacturing data with recursive pattern
and programming via simple geometry and parameters. And explanation of the content and construction process of recursive
programming concept. And generate a large number of derivatives on its own, and evaluates the results
by cost, space, or intensity.

content.$t:
時間表時間: August 24, 2019 - August 31, 2019, 時間表期程: Workshop Schedule, 時間表資訊: </br>, 時間表圖片: img/info/schedule.jpg, 指導老師姓名: Andrew I-kang Li, 指導老師介紹: Assistant Professor of Architecture</br>
Institute of Applied Arts,  National Chiao Tung University</br>
PhD, Governance & Media, Keio University, Japan</br>
</br>
Andrew I-kang Li is an associate professor in computational design at Kyoto Institute of Technology. He uses computational methods to research architectural history, and creates software tools for computational design synthesis and analysis. He has been a visiting faculty member at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, and was a founding faculty member of the School of Architecture of the Chinese University of Hong Kong. He was educated at McGill University, Harvard University, and Massachusetts Institute of Technology., 指導老師路徑: img/headshot/2-1Andrew.jpg, 主題名稱: Structural Origami, 主題主內容: Lecturer: Jason Ku</br>
Hardware: Laptop</br>
Software: Inkscape, Chrome Browser, Plain Text Editor</br>
</br>
The 'Structural Origami' section will enable students to design and build deployable foldable structures fabricated from sheet material. Students will learn how to: fold paper, draw folding patterns programmatically, machine sheet material using a laser cutter, and fabricate thick rigid panels and hinges via a layered construction. Teams of students will design their own original rigid-panel, transformable structures using the techniques they learn in the workshop.
, 主題路徑: img/reference/4-Jason.jpg, 聯絡地址: Taiwan, R.O.C., 聯絡合作夥伴: Keio, 聯絡合作夥伴網址: https://www.keio.ac.jp/zh/, 聯絡合作夥伴圖片: img/connect/cooperate/keio.png, 主講老師姓名: Andrew I-kang Li, 主講老師介紹: Assistant Professor of Architecture</br>
Institute of Applied Arts,  National Chiao Tung University</br>
PhD, Governance & Media, Keio University, Japan</br>
</br>
Andrew I-kang Li is an associate professor in computational design at Kyoto Institute of Technology. He uses computational methods to research architectural history, and creates software tools for computational design synthesis and analysis. He has been a visiting faculty member at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, and was a founding faculty member of the School of Architecture of the Chinese University of Hong Kong. He was educated at McGill University, Harvard University, and Massachusetts Institute of Technology., 主講老師路徑: img/headshot/2-1Andrew.jpg

The 'Structural Origami' section will enable students to design and build deployable foldable structures fabricated from sheet material. 時間表時間: August 31, 2019 - September 7, 2019, 時間表期程: Feedback Form, 時間表資訊: close
content;content;content;content;content;content;content, 指導老師姓名: Stouffs Rudi, 指導老師介紹: Associate Professor / Deputy Head (Architectural)</br>
National University of Singapore</br>
</br>
Rudi Stouffs holds an MSc in Architectural Engineering from the Vrije Universiteit Brussel, an MSc in Computational Design and a PhD in Architecture from Carnegie Mellon University. His research interests include computational issues of description, modelling, and representation for design, mainly in the areas of shape recognition and generation, and building/city information modelling and analysis. 
He is currently Deputy Head (Research), leads the Architectural and Urban Prototyping lab, is Research Thrust Leader for Parametric BIM in the NUS Centre of Excellence in BIM Integration, and co-PI in the Future Cities Laboratory (Phase 2) of the Singapore ETH Centre., 指導老師路徑: img/headshot/2-2Rudi.jpg, 主題名稱: Responsive Skin for Climate Change, 主題主內容: Lecturer: Carl Yu and Hsiang-Yi Liu</br>
Hardware: Arduino mega, 3axis 3d print component kit ( stepping motor, Belt , pulley etc)</br>
Software: Arduino</br>
</br>
At this workshop we will explore an artifact design, which will response
environment change. It is biomimetic structure to adapt its surrounding
environments. Our hyposis is based on the climate change in the near future,
traditional building design is no longer sufficient for human living. How to design
an automatically adaptive structure by single units, but also those units can be
duplicated and assembled to create different type of forms to resist different
climate changes., 主題路徑: img/reference/5-Carl.jpg, 聯絡合作夥伴: Chiao Tung, 聯絡合作夥伴網址: https://www.nctu.edu.tw/en, 聯絡合作夥伴圖片: img/connect/cooperate/chiao.png, 主講老師姓名: Stouffs Rudi, 主講老師介紹: Associate Professor / Deputy Head (Architectural)</br>
National University of Singapore</br>
</br>
Rudi Stouffs holds an MSc in Architectural Engineering from the Vrije Universiteit Brussel, an MSc in Computational Design and a PhD in Architecture from Carnegie Mellon University. His research interests include computational issues of description, modelling, and representation for design, mainly in the areas of shape recognition and generation, and building/city information modelling and analysis. 
He is currently Deputy Head (Research), leads the Architectural and Urban Prototyping lab, is Research Thrust Leader for Parametric BIM in the NUS Centre of Excellence in BIM Integration, and co-PI in the Future Cities Laboratory (Phase 2) of the Singapore ETH Centre., 主講老師路徑: img/headshot/2-2Rudi.jpg

gsx$指導老師介紹.$t:
Associate Professor / Deputy Head (Architectural)</br>
National University of Singapore</br>
</br>
Rudi Stouffs holds an MSc in Architectural Engineering from the Vrije Universiteit Brussel, an MSc in Computational Design and a PhD in Architecture from Carnegie Mellon University. His research interests include computational issues of description, modelling, and representation for design, mainly in the areas of shape recognition and generation, and building/city information modelling and analysis. 
He is currently Deputy Head (Research), leads the Architectural and Urban Prototyping lab, is Research Thrust Leader for Parametric BIM in the NUS Centre of Excellence in BIM Integration, and co-PI in the Future Cities Laboratory (Phase 2) of the Singapore ETH Centre.

gsx$主題主內容.$t:
Lecturer: Carl Yu and Hsiang-Yi Liu</br>
Hardware: Arduino mega, 3axis 3d print component kit ( stepping motor, Belt , pulley etc)</br>
Software: Arduino</br>
</br>
At this workshop we will explore an artifact design, which will response
environment change. It is biomimetic structure to adapt its surrounding
environments. Our hyposis is based on the climate change in the near future,
traditional building design is no longer sufficient for human living. How to design
an automatically adaptive structure by single units, but also those units can be
duplicated and assembled to create different type of forms to resist different
climate changes.

gsx$主講老師介紹.$t:
Associate Professor / Deputy Head (Architectural)</br>
National University of Singapore</br>
</br>
Rudi Stouffs holds an MSc in Architectural Engineering from the Vrije Universiteit Brussel, an MSc in Computational Design and a PhD in Architecture from Carnegie Mellon University. His research interests include computational issues of description, modelling, and representation for design, mainly in the areas of shape recognition and generation, and building/city information modelling and analysis. 
He is currently Deputy Head (Research), leads the Architectural and Urban Prototyping lab, is Research Thrust Leader for Parametric BIM in the NUS Centre of Excellence in BIM Integration, and co-PI in the Future Cities Laboratory (Phase 2) of the Singapore ETH Centre.

content.$t:
指導老師姓名: Jian-You Li, 指導老師介紹: Assistant Professor, Institute of Applied Arts</br>
National Chiao Tung Universityn</br>
PhD, Governance & Media, Keio University, Japan.</br>
</br>
Instructor, Department of Industrial Design, Ming Chi University of Technology.  
Product Envelope Design
【2017】Workshop for designers in HTC</br>
【2016】Parametric Design Workshop in ASUS Design Center</br>
【2014】Attended Art Gallery, SIGGRAPH Asia in Shenzhen</br>, 指導老師路徑: img/headshot/3-1Jianyou.jpg, 主題名稱: Minimal surface in Architecture, Art and Design, 主題主內容: Lecturer: Walaiporn Nakapan, Paulina Neisch</br>
Hardware: 3D printer and Laser cutter</br>
Software: Rhinoceros 5 or 6 + Grasshopper, SketchUp, Craftware or Cura, Adobe PageMaker</br>
</br>
The selected type of minimal surface we will explore in this workshop is called
a Triply periodic minimal surface. It has a crystalline structure and can repeat
itself in all directions. Based on the students’ imagination, it can be
constructed either (1) to be repeated infinitely or (2) to be repeated in a
circular path and comes back to itself. In this workshop we ask the student to
explore one of the possibilities or both in order to come up with an object in
architecture, art and/or design., 主題路徑: img/reference/6-Walaiporn.jpg, 聯絡合作夥伴: Feng Chia, 聯絡合作夥伴網址: http://en.fcu.edu.tw/wSite/mp?mp=3&mobile=false, 聯絡合作夥伴圖片: img/connect/cooperate/feng.png, 主講老師姓名: Jian-You Li, 主講老師介紹: Assistant Professor, Institute of Applied Arts</br>
National Chiao Tung Universityn</br>
PhD, Governance & Media, Keio University, Japan.</br>
</br>
Instructor, Department of Industrial Design, Ming Chi University of Technology.  
Product Envelope Design
【2017】Workshop for designers in HTC</br>
【2016】Parametric Design Workshop in ASUS Design Center</br>
【2014】Attended Art Gallery, SIGGRAPH Asia in Shenzhen</br>, 主講老師路徑: img/headshot/3-1Jianyou.jpg

gsx$指導老師介紹.$t:
Assistant Professor, Institute of Applied Arts</br>
National Chiao Tung Universityn</br>
PhD, Governance & Media, Keio University, Japan.</br>
</br>
Instructor, Department of Industrial Design, Ming Chi University of Technology.  
Product Envelope Design
【2017】Workshop for designers in HTC</br>
【2016】Parametric Design Workshop in ASUS Design Center</br>
【2014】Attended Art Gallery, SIGGRAPH Asia in Shenzhen</br>

gsx$主題名稱.$t: Minimal surface in Architecture, Art and Design

gsx$主題主內容.$t:
Lecturer: Walaiporn Nakapan, Paulina Neisch</br>
Hardware: 3D printer and Laser cutter</br>
Software: Rhinoceros 5 or 6 + Grasshopper, SketchUp, Craftware or Cura, Adobe PageMaker</br>
</br>
The selected type of minimal surface we will explore in this workshop is called
a Triply periodic minimal surface. It has a crystalline structure and can repeat
itself in all directions. Based on the students’ imagination, it can be
constructed either (1) to be repeated infinitely or (2) to be repeated in a
circular path and comes back to itself. In this workshop we ask the student to
explore one of the possibilities or both in order to come up with an object in
architecture, art and/or design.

gsx$主講老師介紹.$t:
Assistant Professor, Institute of Applied Arts</br>
National Chiao Tung Universityn</br>
PhD, Governance & Media, Keio University, Japan.</br>
</br>
Instructor, Department of Industrial Design, Ming Chi University of Technology.  
Product Envelope Design
【2017】Workshop for designers in HTC</br>
【2016】Parametric Design Workshop in ASUS Design Center</br>
【2014】Attended Art Gallery, SIGGRAPH Asia in Shenzhen</br>

content.$t:
指導老師姓名: Jason Ku, 指導老師介紹: Assistant Professor of Electrical Engineering & Computer Science</br>
MIT, USA</br>

content.$t:
指導老師姓名: Carl Yu, 指導老師介紹: OneWork.io Founder</br>
</br>
Carl You found OneWork.io, a data-driven platform for AEC industry. OneWork integrates BIM and data analysis to produce an efficient workflow. Current building process is inefficient and unproductive. He worked at Arup Shenzhen office for 4 years since 2011 at ATG (Advanced Technology Group) to lead BIM technology developments. He is an expert on BIM implementation for multidisciplinary design, such as design analysis and parametric design system for tall buildings structure design and optimization in China.With over 10 years working experience in architecture and technology fields. Before joined ARUP, he worked as Full time researcher at MIT media Lab for 2 years; specially focus on rapid prototyping, game engine, building performance simulation and sensor system. 5 years design architect position in Taiwan, Australia, Dubai, USA and China. , 指導老師路徑: img/headshot/5-1Carl.jpg, 聯絡合作夥伴: NUS, 聯絡合作夥伴網址: http://nus.edu.sg/, 聯絡合作夥伴圖片: img/connect/cooperate/nus.png, 主講老師姓名: Carl Yu, 主講老師介紹: OneWork.io Founder</br>
</br>

content.$t:
指導老師姓名: Hsiang-Yi Liu, 指導老師介紹: Architect, Landscape Designer and Project Manager</br>
</br>
I’m living in Taiwan and Mainland China. This experience gives me a better understanding of design and life. As a landscape architect, a designer, a coffee barista and a cross-border curator. I have a broad vision of different fields. From architecture design to landscape design, I have large project management and coordination experiences. I used to assist in the development of design guidelines in numbers of projects. And I used to work in urban design and cluster design team. Shenzhen Vanke Design Commune Landscape North Corridor chief designer. 
Vanke Design Commune Chief Design General Coordinator.</br>
【2018】The curator of Vanke Design Commune brand events.</br>
【2018】The director of Shenzhen Nanshan Smart City Tender.</br>
</br>
【2014-2018】Landscape designer and Project Manager</br>
【2017-2019】International competition organizer</br>
【2016-2017】Product design & research manager</br>
【2017-2018】Vanke Design Commune - Brand Organizer</br>
【2018-2019】Vanke Design Department-Deputy Director</br>, 指導老師路徑: img/headshot/5-2Liu.jpg, 聯絡合作夥伴: Yuntech, 聯絡合作夥伴網址: http://www2010.yuntech.edu.tw/english/, 聯絡合作夥伴圖片: img/connect/cooperate/yuntech.png, 主講老師姓名: Hsiang-Yi Liu, 主講老師介紹: Architect, Landscape Designer and Project Manager</br>
